main event: 1st Lt. Harry Lee Roe, Jr., Ohio Air National Guard Pilot reported sighting a bright light in the sky between 2045 and 2215 hours on 23 June 1954 while on a routine flight between Dayton and Columbus. The unidentified object appeared at approximately 8,000 feet and remained at an altitude of 7,000 to 8,000 feet throughout the observation.
interesting points: Lt. Roe attempted various maneuvers to get the object into the twilight and obtain a silhouette, but the object maintained the same speed as his aircraft and stayed with him.
The object seemed to be slightly above Lt. Roe at all times and was estimated to be anywhere from 1,000 to 1,800 feet away from him.
Both the size and intensity of the object were very similar to an aircraft taillight, and it seemed to watch Lt. Roe's maneuvers closely.
Lt. Roe was unable to identify the object and attempted to get the object into the twilight for a silhouette without success.

The sighting was reported to the Operations Officer of the Ohio Air National Guard stationed at the Dayton Municipal Airport, and efforts were made to alert the Municipal Airport tower personnel as Lt. Roe flew over.
witnesses: 1st Lt. Harry Lee Roe, Jr., Ohio Air National Guard Pilot
